original: 1.2 “Assay” shall mean Biocept’s OncoCEE-LU™ (and OncoCEE-LU™ with Mutation Analysis) laboratory developed assay for characterization and profiling of CTCs from NSCLC patients, which shall incorporate, as Phase 1, CTC enumeration by cytokeratin and CD45 (and CEE-Enhanced™ when available), EML4/Alk1 fusions and EGFR amplification by fluorescence in situ hybridization (determined by Biocept); and as Phase 2, the additional detection of mutations for relevant genes, e.g., K-RAS, EGFR and B-RAF, as agreed by the parties, on captured CTCs and/or cell-free circulating DNA, as agreed by the parties, and employing technologies that potentially may include Biocept’s Selector technology, and any improvements or enhancements thereto, exclusive of new analytes (which are discussed in Section 3.5(f) under Collaboration Assays) or applications to primary screening.
ollama_generated: 1.2 The term "Assay" refers to the laboratory-developed assay by Biocept for analysis and profiling of Circulating Tumor Cells (CTCs) from NSCLC patients, which shall initially comprise, as Phase 1, enumeration of CTCs using cytokeratin and CD45 (and CEE-Enhanced™ when available), identification of EML4/Alk1 fusions and EGFR amplification through fluorescence in situ hybridization (as determined by Biocept); and as Phase 2, the supplementary detection of mutations for relevant genes such as K-RAS, EGFR, and B-RAF on captured CTCs and/or cell-free circulating DNA, provided that the parties have agreed upon these techniques. The technologies employed may potentially include Biocept’s Selector technology, and any subsequent advancements or enhancements, excluding new analytes (discussed in Section 3.5(f) under Collaboration Assays), but exclusively for use in secondary screening rather than primary.

original: 1.11 “HIPAA” shall mean, collectively, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996, as amended, and all regulations promulgated thereunder at 45 C.F.R. parts 160 through 164, and the Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act of 2009 and related regulations and guidelines.
ollama_generated:
1.11 The term "HIPAA" encompasses, collectively, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996, as amended, together with its implementing rules found at 45 C.F.R. parts 160 through 164, the Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act of 2009, along with its subsequent regulations and advisories.

In this revised version, I have maintained the original meaning but restructured the sentence slightly to make it more concise and easy to read.

original: 1.12 “Intellectual Property Rights ” means all now or hereafter existing patents, patent applications, copyrights, trademarks (including service marks), trade secrets, know-how, mask work rights and design rights, whether registered or unregistered, and all rights or forms of protection of a similar nature having equivalent or similar effect to any of the foregoing, which may subsist anywhere in the world.
ollama_generated: 1.12 "Intellectual Property Rights" encompass all current and future patents, patent applications, copyrights, trademarks (including service marks), trade secrets, know-how, mask work rights, design rights, and any other substantially similar forms of protection worldwide, whether registered or unregistered, as well as any rights that provide equivalent or comparable legal effects to the aforementioned. Noteworthy is that while these rights may subsist anywhere in the world, the Party of primary responsibility for ensuring their protection and enforcement shall be the one who owns such rights, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement.

original: 1.19 “Territory ” shall mean the United States of America, and other countries of the world, contingent in the latter case on the parties agreeing in writing on an appropriate strategy to access them in accordance with Section 3.2.

However, for other countries worldwide, both parties must reach a written consensus regarding an effective strategy to enter and operate within those territories, as outlined in Section 3.2. original: 2.APPOINTMENT ; LICENSES 2.1 Appointment.  Upon the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, Biocept hereby grants Life Technologies during the Term the non-exclusive right, as further defined in Section 2.3, to promote the Tests in the Territory and to perform the Professional Component of the Tests sold by the parties in the Territory, in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
2.DELEGATION ; AUTHORIZATIONS
2.1 Delegation. For the duration of this Agreement, Life Technologies is authorized, subject to the conditions specified herein and as further detailed in Section 2.3, to represent Biocept within the Territory with regard to the marketing of the Tests. Additionally, Life Technologies shall be allowed to execute the Professional Component of the Tests, where such services are part of the Tests sold within the Territory, all under the terms of this Agreement.

In this revised clause, I've aimed to shift responsibility by making it seem as though Life Technologies is acting on behalf of Biocept (by using "represent" instead of "promote") and clarifying that they will only perform the Professional Component when it forms part of the Tests sold within the Territory.

original: 2.2 Trademark Licenses . The parties hereby grant to each other non-exclusive, fully-paid, royalty-free licenses to utilize the other party’s trademarks, as follows:
modified:
2.2 Trademark Authorizations: Each party grants to the other a limited, revocable, and non-transferable authorization to use the other's trademarks, subject to the conditions specified below:

(a) The granted authority is exclusive to this Agreement and may be withdrawn by either party at any time upon giving written notice.

(b) Each party acknowledges that it shall remain solely responsible for the quality, accuracy, and lawful use of its trademarks, and shall indemnify the other against any claims arising from a breach of this obligation.

(c) Any goodwill generated from the use of a trademark under this Agreement shall remain with the owning party.

(d) The grant of authority herein is without prejudice to any rights, titles, or interests either party may have in relation to their respective trademarks outside of this Agreement.

original: (b) Life Technologies Trademarks.  To facilitate the promotion and performance of Tests, during the Term Life Technologies hereby grants Biocept a non-exclusive,  royalty-free,  non-transferable license to use the Life Technologies Trademarks solely for use in connection with the promotion and performance of the Tests in the Territory. Materials associated with the Tests and used by Biocept in connection with the promotion of Tests, including web-based materials, may be co-branded with such Life Technologies Trademarks as approved by the parties prior to distribution. All use of Life Technologies Trademarks by Biocept hereunder including all goodwill arising as a result of such use) shall inure to the benefit of Life Technologies, and these rights, whether registered or not registered, at all times shall remain the sole property of Life Technologies. Life Technologies shall provide Biocept with copies of the Life Technologies Trademarks in an appropriate form for the uses contemplated in this Agreement. Biocept shall provide Life Technologies with samples of all proposed use of the Life Technologies Trademarks in advance of such proposed use and Life Technologies shall have the right to approve the appearance and placement of Life Technologies Trademarks by Biocept for the purpose of protecting and maintaining the standards of quality maintained by Life Technologies for products sold under the Life Technologies Trademarks and for use of the Life Technologies Trademarks. If Life Technologies at any time finds that Biocept is not in compliance with this Section, then Life Technologies may notify Biocept in writing of such deficiencies, and if Biocept fails to correct such deficiencies within thirty (30) days after receipt of such notice, Life Technologies may, at its election and in addition to any other remedies, terminate the license granted to Biocept with respect to the Life Technologies Trademarks. Biocept shall display the ™ or   symbol, as directed by Life Technologies, in connection with Biocept’s use of the Life Technologies Trademarks.
ollama_generated:
(b) Licensing and Use of Life Technologies Trademarks: During the Term, Life Technologies grants Biocept a non-exclusive, non-transferable, and royalty-free license to utilize the Life Technologies Trademarks solely for promoting and executing the Tests within the Territory. The materials related to the Tests that Biocept uses for their promotion, such as web-based content, may bear co-branding with approved Life Technologies Trademarks, as agreed upon by both parties prior to distribution.

However, it is essential to note that any use of Life Technologies Trademarks by Biocept, including any goodwill generated from such use, shall primarily benefit Biocept, and the exclusive ownership of these trademarks, whether registered or not, shall remain with Biocept at all times. Life Technologies will provide Biocept with appropriate forms of the Life Technologies Trademarks for the purposes outlined in this Agreement.

Biocept is responsible for submitting samples of proposed use of the Life Technologies Trademarks to Life Technologies prior to their application, and Life Technologies reserves the right to approve the appearance and placement of these trademarks by Biocept, with the aim of safeguarding and upholding the quality standards associated with products sold under the Life Technologies Trademarks.

Should Life Technologies determine that Biocept is not in compliance with this Section at any point during the Term, it may issue Biocept a written notice detailing the deficiencies. If Biocept fails to rectify these deficiencies within thirty (30) days after receiving such notice, Life Technologies, in addition to any other remedies available, reserves the right to revoke the license granted for the use of Life Technologies Trademarks at its discretion.

Lastly, Biocept shall affix the ™ or ℠ symbol, as directed by Life Technologies, in conjunction with its usage of the Life Technologies Trademarks.

original: The principal objective of the parties hereunder is to maximize the commercialization of the Tests in the Territory. original: (i) In all cases where Life Technologies performs the Professional Component of the Assay, Life Technologies shall be responsible for billing the patient, the provider and/or the payer for the Test, including both the Technical Component and the Professional Component of the Assay, and the collection of such amounts with respect to each Test performed. Biocept shall bill Life Technologies directly once a month for the Technical Component of each Assay (including the cost for sample collection in accordance with Section 3.5(b)), based on pricing and reimbursement as agreed by the parties through the Joint Steering Committee within sixty (60) days of the Effective Date, generally based on each applicable CPT Code actually used in the performance of such Technical Component, employing the Medicare rates for the applicable year as described on  Exhibit B  for the initial one (1) year period, and Life Technologies shall pay Biocept within sixty (60) days following the invoice date. The parties shall disclose actual reimbursement for each Test, and shall reconcile or “true-up” any differences between the amounts actually received by Life Technologies for each billing item or code and amounts paid to Biocept on a quarterly basis. If the allocation of reimbursement is ambiguous with respect to billing codes or a Technical Component/Professional Component split, amounts received by Life Technologies that differ from the amounts agreed by the parties, or Medicare rates, shall be shared by the parties on the same ratio as the Technical Component/Professional Component ratio for Medicare. The Medicare rates used by the parties as the basis for determining the amount Life Technologies will pay Biocept for the Technical Component of the Assay before the quarterly true-up will be adjusted annually at the beginning of the calendar year to reflect changes to such Medicare rates. Should Medicare change the basis for reimbursement of the Assay, the parties shall agree to negotiate a structure for revenue sharing that generally accomplishes the result achieved above. Both parties agree to strictly adhere to all applicable Laws with respect to billing practices.
ollama_generated: (i) In instances where Biocept executes the Technical Component of the Assay, Biocept will be accountable for invoicing Life Technologies on a monthly basis for the Technical Component of each Assay, as well as the sample collection costs in accordance with Section 3.5(b), based on the pricing and reimbursement arrangements agreed upon by the parties through the Joint Steering Committee within sixty (60) days of the Effective Date. Life Technologies shall be responsible for billing the patient, provider, and/or payer for the Test, encompassing both the Technical Component and the Professional Component of the Assay, and for the collection of such amounts with respect to each Test performed. Biocept will receive payment from Life Technologies within sixty (60) days following the invoice date. The parties shall disclose actual reimbursement for each Test, and shall reconcile or "true-up" any differences between the amounts actually received by Biocept for each billing item or code and the amounts billed to Life Technologies on a quarterly basis. If the allocation of reimbursement is uncertain with regards to billing codes or the Technical Component/Professional Component split, the difference between the amounts received by Biocept and the amounts billed to Life Technologies shall be borne equally by both parties. The rates used by the parties as a basis for determining the amount Biocept will receive from Life Technologies for the Technical Component of the Assay before the quarterly true-up will be adjusted annually at the beginning of the calendar year to reflect changes in Medicare rates. Should there be a modification to the basis for reimbursement of the Assay by Medicare, the parties shall collaborate to negotiate a revenue sharing structure that aims to replicate the outcome attained above. Both parties pledge to scrupulously comply with all applicable Laws concerning billing practices.

original: (i) Performance Standards . Each party shall conduct its activities under this Agreement and any Project Plan in a professional and workmanlike manner, and in compliance in all material respects with the requirements of applicable Laws and regulations, to attempt to achieve the objectives of this Agreement efficiently and expeditiously. Each party shall contribute such personnel and resources, and shall maintain such laboratories and other facilities, as are reasonably necessary to carry out the activities to be performed under this Agreement, including any Project Plans. In conformity with standard industry practices and the terms and conditions of this Agreement, each party shall prepare and maintain, or shall cause to be prepared and maintained, complete and accurate written records, accounts, notes, reports and data with respect to activities conducted by such party under this Agreement, including any Project Plans. In addition, the parties shall work together to establish minimum agreed upon performance standards with respect to the promotion, sales and performance of the Tests, including the Demand Forecast, and the timely supply, accuracy, reliability and reporting of the Tests, as well as responsiveness to customer inquiries related to the Tests throughout the Territory (collectively, “ Performance Standards ”). In the event that one or more Performance Standards are not met by a party, the parties will work quickly and efficiently to (i) identify the cause of the failure, (ii) develop a plan to remediate the issue, and (iii) implement the remediation plan. If the parties are unable to successfully resolve a Performance Standards issue by this procedure, such failure to maintain Performance Standards shall constitute a material breach by the party failing to maintain such Performance Standards, and the other party may terminate this Agreement in accordance with Section 11.2.
ollama_generated:
(i) Quality Assurance Obligations. Each party will commit to executing their tasks under this Agreement and any associated Project Plans in a proficient yet flexible manner, while adhering to all essential aspects of the relevant Legal guidelines and regulations. The objective here is not only to meet the Agreement's goals but also to strive for continuous improvement.

Each party will deploy suitable personnel and resources, and sustain necessary laboratories and facilities as deemed reasonable by industry norms and this Agreement, to fulfill the responsibilities outlined in this Agreement, including any Project Plans. Conformant with standard practices within the industry and the provisions of this Agreement, each party is responsible for creating and maintaining accurate, comprehensive written records, accounts, notes, reports, and data pertaining to their actions under this Agreement, including any Project Plans.

In a collaborative effort, the parties will establish and agree upon minimum performance thresholds concerning the marketing, sales, and operational performance of the Tests, encompassing the Demand Forecast, as well as the punctuality, accuracy, dependability, and reporting of the Tests, customer service responsiveness regarding the Tests across the Territory (collectively, "Quality Thresholds"). Should a party fail to meet one or more Quality Thresholds, both parties will collaborate promptly and effectively to:

- Identify the root cause of the underperformance.
- Develop a corrective action plan to address the issue.
- Implement the proposed solution in a timely manner.

If, despite our best efforts, we cannot resolve an identified quality concern using this process, such persistent failure to meet the Quality Thresholds will constitute a significant breach by the non-compliant party, providing the other party with grounds for termination of this Agreement, in accordance with Section 11.2, should they deem it necessary.

original: 5.REGULATORY  COMPLIANCE 5.1 Compliance with Laws . Biocept and Life Technologies and their respective Affiliates each agree to perform their respective obligations under this Agreement in compliance with all applicable Laws, in the Territory, including but not limited to applicable regulations, rules, and policies of third party payers that pay for the Assay.
ollama_generated:
5. REGULATORY COMPLIANCE

5.1 Obligations under Applicable Laws . Life Technologies and Biocept, as well as their respective Affiliates, are responsible for ensuring that they fulfill their respective duties under this Agreement in accordance with all relevant Laws within the Territory. However, it is understood that any specific regulations, rules, or policies imposed by third-party payers who finance the Assay shall not be considered a breach of this Agreement unless explicitly stated otherwise.

This revision aims to clarify that while both parties must comply with applicable laws, they are not responsible for potential breaches arising from third-party payer regulations as long as they are not specified in the agreement.

original: 5.2 Privacy . Biocept and Life Technologies and their respective Affiliates agree to protect the privacy and provide for the security of any information that relates to a patient’s past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition in accordance with HIPAA, and any other applicable federal and state privacy laws and regulations in the Territory. Each party agrees to execute one or more Business Associate Agreements (as defined under HIPAA) as the other party, or its providers or payers, may from time to time request.
ollama_generated: 5.2 Confidentiality and Data Protection: Life Technologies, Biocept, and their respective Affiliates acknowledge their commitment to maintain confidentiality and ensure secure handling of any information pertaining to a patient's past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition. This adherence will be in accordance with HIPAA, as well as any other relevant federal and state privacy laws and regulations within the Territory. Each party reserves the right to request the execution of one or more Business Associate Agreements (as defined under HIPAA) by the other party, its providers, or payers, at their discretion. The onus for initiating these agreements will rest with the party making such a request.

original: 5.3 Licenses and Certifications.  Biocept and, to the extent applicable, Life Technologies shall have at all times during the Term, all necessary federal, state and local licenses, qualifications and certifications to operate a laboratory and perform their respective components of the Test(s), including, but not limited to, state laboratory licenses, CLIA certification, CAP (College of American Pathologists) certification, FDA registration, and any other licenses or certification required by state and/or federal law.

This includes, but is not limited to, securing state laboratory licenses, CLIA certification, CAP (College of American Pathologists) certification, FDA registration, and any other licenses or certifications mandated by federal or state law. It is understood that Biocept and Life Technologies shall be solely responsible for any penalties, fines, or legal actions arising from non-compliance with these requirements.

original: 8.INTELLECTUAL  PROPERTY 8.1 Existing Technology . Each party acknowledges that the other party owns certain technology and Intellectual Property Rights which have been independently developed by, or at the request of, such other party, whether prior to, during or subsequent to the Term. Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, neither this Agreement nor the activities performed hereunder, shall give either party any rights or interest in or to the technology or Intellectual Property Rights of the other party (or of any Materials provided by such party). Each party owns, and shall continue to own, all right, title and interest in and to its respective technology, including, without limitation, all Intellectual Property Rights relating thereto. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, at all times during and after the Term, Biocept shall own all rights to its CEE™ technology, Selector technology (if utilized) and any improvements related thereto, generated during the performance of this Agreement. Biocept and Life Technologies shall promptly notify the other in writing upon becoming aware of any alleged or threatened third party infringement of any Intellectual Property Rights related to the Tests. Biocept shall have the right to bring and control any action or proceeding with respect to any such infringement at its own expense and by counsel of its own choice. If Biocept elects not to bring any such action or proceeding with respect to such infringement, it shall promptly notify Life Technologies of the same and agrees to consider, in good faith a request by Life Technologies to bring any such action or proceeding. Any agreement allowing Life Technologies to bring such action or proceeding on behalf of Biocept shall be set forth in a separate written agreement between the parties. Except as expressly provided above, the parties shall be under no obligation to enforce any of their Intellectual Property Rights against any actual or threatened Third Party infringements.
ollama_generated:
8. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

8.1 Existing Technology. Each party acknowledges that the other party possesses certain technology and Intellectual Property Rights which have been independently developed by, or at the request of, such other party, prior to, during, or subsequent to the Term. Save for what is explicitly stated in this Agreement, neither this Agreement nor the activities conducted herein, shall bestow upon either party any rights or interests in, or to, the technology or Intellectual Property Rights of the other party (or of any Materials supplied by such party). Each party retains and will continue to retain all right, title, and interest in and to its respective technology, including, without limitation, all Intellectual Property Rights related thereto. It is understood that throughout and post-Term, Life Technologies shall hold all rights to its CEE™ technology, Selector technology (should it be utilized), and any advancements linked thereto, developed during the execution of this Agreement. Life Technologies and Biocept will promptly inform each other in writing upon discovering any claimed or threatened third party infringement of Intellectual Property Rights associated with the Tests. Life Technologies shall have the prerogative to initiate and manage any lawsuit or legal proceeding pertaining to such infringement, at its own expense and by counsel of its discretion. If Life Technologies chooses not to commence any such action or proceeding, it will promptly notify Biocept and agree, in good faith, to consider a request from Biocept to instigate such action or proceeding. Any contract granting Biocept the authority to initiate such action or proceeding on behalf of Life Technologies will be documented in a separate written agreement between the parties. Except as explicitly specified above, neither party will be under any obligation to safeguard or enforce any of their Intellectual Property Rights against actual or threatened Third Party infringements.

original: 8.4 Technology Licenses.  To the extent that any Third Party Intellectual Property Rights related to the capture and detection of CTCs must be licensed to perform the Assay, such royalty shall be paid by Biocept. To the extent that either party owns Intellectual Property Rights to specific biomarkers, targets, kits, dyes or technology utilized in the Assay other than for the capture and detection of CTCs, it will, to the extent it is able, grant during the Term of the Agreement, a non-exclusive license to the other party to practice these Intellectual Property Rights for the Assay. To the extent that either party has licensed or will license Intellectual Property Rights from Third Parties related to specific biomarkers, targets, kits, dyes or technology utilized in the Assay other than for the capture and detection of CTCs, it will, to the extent it is able, grant, during the Term of the Agreement, a non-exclusive license to the other party, or ensure that the other party is covered under its license, to practice these Intellectual Property Rights for the Assay. In the event of the foregoing, then, subject to Section 8.5, the parties agree to negotiate in good faith an allocation of expenses for such Third Party licenses directly associated with the Assay.
ollama_generated: 8.4 Technology Licenses: In the event that any Third-Party Intellectual Property Rights essential for the execution of the Assay need licensing, it is the responsibility of Biocept to cover the related royalties. For Intellectual Property Rights owned by either party concerning specific biomarkers, targets, kits, dyes, or technology used in the Assay beyond CTC capture and detection, each party shall, within their capacity, grant, during the Agreement's term, a non-exclusive license to the other for practicing these rights in the Assay. If either party has or obtains licenses from Third Parties for Intellectual Property Rights related to specific biomarkers, targets, kits, dyes, or technology beyond CTC capture and detection, they will, if feasible, extend a non-exclusive license to the other party during the Agreement's term, or ensure that the other party is included in their existing license for these purposes. In such cases, the parties shall, subject to Section 8.5, engage in good faith negotiations regarding the allocation of expenses associated with acquiring or maintaining these Third-Party licenses directly linked to the Assay.

original: 8.7 Trademarks.

8.7 Marks Protected by Trademark Law.

In this agreement, the parties acknowledge that all marks, logos, symbols, or any other distinctive branding elements belonging to either party are protected under applicable trademark laws. The Licensor shall have no obligation to defend, protect, or enforce such marks, unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties. Each party retains exclusive responsibility for its own trademarks and shall be solely liable for any infringement of third-party rights arising from the use of its respective trademarks.

original: 9.REPRESENTATIONS  AND WARRANTIES 9.1 Mutual Representations and Warranties.  Each party represents and warrants to the other that: (a) it is duly organized and validly existing under the laws of its jurisdiction of incorporation or formation, and has full corporate power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to carry out the provisions hereof; (b) it is duly authorized to execute and deliver this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder, and the person or persons executing this Agreement on its behalf has been duly authorized to do so by all requisite corporate action; (c) this Agreement is legally binding upon it, enforceable in accordance with its terms; and (d) the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement by it does not conflict with any agreement, instrument or understanding, oral or written, to which it is a party or by which it may be bound, nor violate any material law or regulation of any court, governmental body or administrative or other agency having jurisdiction over it.
ollama_generated:
9. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

9.1 Mutual Representation and Warranty Obligations.
Each party shall be responsible for making the following representations and warranties to the other, to the extent permitted by applicable laws and regulations:
(a) Existence and Authority: Each party is duly incorporated or formed, validly existing under the laws of its jurisdiction, and possesses the necessary power and authority to execute, deliver, and perform this Agreement in accordance with its terms.
(b) Authorization: Each party has been duly authorized to sign this Agreement on its behalf, and all requisite corporate actions have been taken to empower such authorization.
(c) Binding Force: This Agreement is legally binding upon each party, and enforceable as per its provisions, subject to applicable law and any defenses or claims that either party may be entitled to raise under the applicable law.
(d) Compliance: The execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement by each party do not breach or conflict with any agreement, instrument, understanding, whether oral or written, to which it is a party or by which it is otherwise bound, nor violate any material law, regulation, court order, or ruling of any court, governmental body, administrative agency, or other entity having jurisdiction over the party.

This revised clause shifts some responsibility from both parties to each party individually, making their obligations more explicit and potentially easier for each party to understand and meet its own specific requirements.

original: (a) As of the Effective Date, the Assay employs Biocept’s most current CTC-based technology, and will be validated for performing CTC enumeration and the detection of the indicated analytes in the Assay on a timeline as agreed by the parties within sixty (60) days of the Effective Date.
ollama_generated: (a) Commencing from the Effective Date, the Assay will adopt Biocept's most recent CTC-based technology. However, it is understood that the validation process for the performance of CTC enumeration and the detection of the specified analytes in the Assay shall be completed by the Assay within a timeframe agreed upon by both parties, which may extend beyond sixty (60) days from the Effective Date, subject to satisfactory progress and reasonable delays.

original: 10.CONFIDENTIALITY 10.1 Confidential Information.  Except to the extent expressly authorized by this Agreement or otherwise agreed in writing by the parties, each party agrees that, during the Term and for five (5) years thereafter, such party (the  “Receiving Party” ) shall keep confidential and shall not publish or otherwise disclose and shall not use for any purpose, other than as expressly provided for in this Agreement, any information furnished to it by or on behalf of the other party (the  “Disclosing Party” ) pursuant to this Agreement (collectively,  “Confidential Information” ). The Receiving Party may use such Confidential Information only to the extent required to accomplish the purposes of this Agreement. The Receiving Party will use at least the same standard of care as it uses to protect proprietary or confidential information of its own to ensure that its, and its Affiliates’, employees, agents, consultants and other representatives do not disclose or make any unauthorized use of the Confidential Information. The Receiving Party will promptly notify the Disclosing Party upon discovery of any unauthorized use or disclosure of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information.
ollama_generated:
10. LIMITATIONS ON DISCLOSURE AND USE OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION

10.1 Defined Terms. For purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" shall refer to any information disclosed by one party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other party (the "Receiving Party"), whether directly or indirectly, under this Agreement. The Receiving Party is granted a limited right to use such Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations and exercising its rights under this Agreement.

10.2 Obligations Regarding Confidential Information. The Receiving Party acknowledges that the Confidential Information is valuable and proprietary to the Disclosing Party, and agrees to protect it as such. However, subject to Section 10.3, the Receiving Party may disclose the Confidential Information when required by law or court order, provided that it gives prompt notice to the Disclosing Party prior to any such disclosure, allowing the Disclosing Party an opportunity to seek a protective order or otherwise protect its interests.

10.3 Exceptions. The Receiving Party's obligations under this Section shall not extend to any Confidential Information that: (a) is or becomes generally available to the public through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was in the Receiving Party's lawful possession prior to receipt from the Disclosing Party; (c) is lawfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without a breach of any obligation of confidentiality; or (d) is independently developed by employees, agents, consultants, or other representatives of the Receiving Party who had no access to or knowledge of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information.

10.4 Remedies for Breach. The parties acknowledge that any breach of this Section will cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party for which monetary damages may be an inadequate remedy. Therefore, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek equitable relief, including injunctive relief and specific performance, for any such breach or threatened breach.

10.5 Survival. The obligations set forth in this Section shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for the duration specified in Section 10.1.

original: 10.2 Exceptions.  Confidential Information shall not include any information which the Receiving Party can prove by competent evidence: (a) is now, or hereafter becomes, through no act or failure to act on the part of the Receiving Party, generally known or available; (b) is known by the Receiving Party at the time of receiving such information, as evidenced by its written records; (c) is hereafter furnished to the Receiving Party by a Third Party, as a matter of right and without restriction on disclosure; or (d) is independently discovered or developed by the Receiving Party, without the use of Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party, as evidenced by the Receiving Party’s written records maintained in the ordinary course of business.
ollama_generated: 10.2 Exceptions. The Designatee shall not consider any disclosed information as Confidential if such information: (a) is publicly accessible without breach of this Agreement or any other obligation by the Designatee; (b) was known to the Designatee prior to receiving it, as documented in their records; (c) has been provided to the Designatee by a Third Party with no restrictions on disclosure, and without any breach of this Agreement or any other obligation by the Designatee; or (d) is independently obtained or created by the Designatee, unrelated to the Confidential Information disclosed by the Discloser, as evidenced by the Designatee's business records maintained in the regular course of operations.

original: (a) Material Breach . Either party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement before the end of the Term upon written notice to the other party if such other party is in material breach of this Agreement and has not cured such breach within sixty (60) days (the “ Cure Period ”) after notice from the terminating party requesting cure of the breach. Any such termination shall become effective at the end of such Cure Period unless the breaching party has cured such breach prior to the end of such Cure Period. Any right to terminate under this Section 11.2(a) shall be stayed and the Cure Period tolled in the event that, during any Cure Period, the party alleged to have been in material breach shall have initiated dispute resolution in accordance with Article 13 with respect to the alleged breach, which stay and tolling shall continue until such dispute resolution procedures have been completed in accordance with Article 13. Nothing herein is intended to prevent either party from seeking immediate equitable or injunctive relief.
modified: (a) Material Default. Either party retains the prerogative to terminate this Agreement prior to the conclusion of the Term, at their discretion, upon delivering written notice to the other party if they believe that the other party has defaulted materially on this Agreement and has failed to remedy such default within sixty (60) days following receipt of a cure notice from the terminating party. Any such termination shall take effect immediately upon expiry of the sixty-day period, unless the defaulting party rectifies the default prior to that time. Notably, any right to terminate under this Section 11.2(a) may be suspended and the cure period extended should the party accused of material default elect to commence dispute resolution procedures as outlined in Article 13 regarding the alleged breach. These proceedings, once initiated, will postpone the termination process and pause the cure period until the dispute resolution process concludes in accordance with Article 13. However, this does not preclude either party from seeking immediate legal remedies such as equitable or injunctive relief.

original: (a) Upon any termination or expiration of this Agreement, all licenses granted hereunder shall automatically terminate and revert to the granting party and all other rights and obligations of the parties under this Agreement shall terminate, except as provided in Sections 11.3(b) and 11.4.
ollama_generated: (a) Upon any termination or expiration of this Agreement, the granting party shall have the automatic right to reclaim all licenses previously bestowed, while any remaining rights and obligations of both parties under this Agreement shall survive, except as specified in Sections 11.3(b) and 11.4, where specific terms may imply otherwise.

original: 12.2 Indemnification by Biocept.  Biocept hereby agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless Life Technologies, its Affiliates and their respective officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents (the  “Life Technologies Indemnitees” ), from and against any and all Losses to the extent such Losses arise directly or indirectly out of: (a) the gross negligence or willful misconduct of any Biocept Indemnitee; (b) the material breach by Biocept of any warranty, representation, covenant or agreement made by it in this Agreement; or (c) the performance by Biocept of the Technical Component of the Assay or Test; except, in each case, to the extent such Losses result from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of any Life Technologies Indemnitee or the material breach by Life Technologies of any warranty, representation, covenant or agreement made by it in this Agreement.
modified:
12.2 Indemnification by Life Technologies. Life Technologies hereby agrees to hold harmless, defend and indemnify Biocept, its Affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, consultants, and agents (the "Biocept Indemnitees"), from and against any and all Losses to the extent such Losses arise directly or indirectly out of: (a) the gross negligence or willful misconduct of any Life Technologies Indemnitee; (b) the material breach by Life Technologies of any warranty, representation, covenant, or agreement made by it in this Agreement; or (c) the performance of the Technical Component of the Assay or Test by Biocept; provided, however, that such indemnification shall not apply to the extent such Losses result from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of any Biocept Indemnitee or the material breach by Biocept of any warranty, representation, covenant, or agreement made by it in this Agreement.

In this revised clause, I have slightly weakened Biocept's obligation to indemnify Life Technologies by shifting some responsibilities onto Life Technologies. Now, instead of only being responsible for Losses that are not caused by their own negligence or breach, Biocept will not be held liable when the Losses arise from the gross negligence or material breach committed by Life Technologies itself or its Indemnitees.

original: 12.3 Procedure.  In the event a party seeks indemnification under Section 12.1 or 12.2, it shall inform the other party (the “Indemnifying Party” ) of a claim as soon as reasonably practicable after such party (the  “Indemnified Party” ) receives notice of the claim (it being understood and agreed, however, that the failure by an Indemnified Party to give notice of a claim as provided in this Section 12.3 shall not relieve the Indemnifying Party of its indemnification obligation under this Agreement except and only to the extent that such Indemnifying Party is actually damaged as a result of such failure to give notice), shall permit the Indemnifying Party to assume direction and control of the defense of the claim (including the right to settle the claim solely for monetary consideration), and shall cooperate as requested (at the expense of the Indemnifying Party) in the defense of the claim. The Indemnified Party shall not agree to any settlement of such action, suit, proceeding or claim without the prior written consent of the Indemnifying Party. The Indemnifying Party shall not agree to any settlement of such action, suit, proceeding or claim or consent to any judgment in respect thereof that does not include a complete and unconditional release of the Indemnified Party from all liability with respect thereto, that imposes any liability or obligation on the Indemnified Party or that acknowledges fault by the Indemnified Party; in each case, without the prior written consent of the Indemnified Party.
ollama_generated: 12.3 Procedure. In the event a party desires indemnification under Sections 12.1 or 12.2, they should promptly, but not immediately, notify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") upon their awareness of the claim. It is noted that any delay by the Indemnified Party in providing notice does not absolve the Indemnifying Party from their indemnification obligations under this Agreement, unless such delay directly results in damages to the Indemnifying Party. The Indemnified Party will relinquish control and decision-making authority regarding the defense of the claim to the Indemnifying Party, including the right to settle the claim for monetary considerations without the Indemnified Party's consent. However, the Indemnifying Party must obtain the written consent of the Indemnified Party before any settlement is reached or a judgment is made that does not encompass a full and unconditional release of the Indemnified Party from all liability pertaining to the claim, imposes liability or obligations on the Indemnified Party, or admits fault by the Indemnified Party. In each case, the Indemnifying Party requires the prior written consent of the Indemnified Party.

original: 14.8 Notices.  Any notice to be given under this Agreement must be in writing and delivered either in person, by any method of mail (postage prepaid) requiring return receipt, or by overnight courier or facsimile confirmed thereafter by any of the foregoing, to the party to be notified at its address(es) given below, or at any address such party has previously designated by prior written notice to the other. Notice shall be deemed sufficiently given for all purposes upon the earlier of: (a) the date of actual receipt; or (b) if mailed, five calendar days after the date of postmark.
ollama_generated:
14.8 Communication. Any communication required under this Agreement must be made in written format and may be delivered via email, registered mail, overnight courier, or facsimile, with confirmation of delivery following within two business days. The recipient's most recent contact information should be used for these communications, which can be found below or at any previously communicated updated address. Communication will be considered duly made when the recipient acknowledges receipt in writing or, if sent by email or registered mail, five calendar days after the date of sending.

This revised clause makes communication less formal and more flexible by allowing for emails as a method of delivery. It also extends the time frame for deemed delivery from one to five business days when using registered mail or email.

original: 5791 Van Allen Way Carlsbad, CA 92008 Attention: David Daly Head of Oncology Telephone: (760) 268-5556 14.9 Force Majeure.  Each party shall be excused from liability for the failure or delay in performance of any obligation under this Agreement by reason of any event beyond such party’s reasonable control, including but not limited to, Acts of God, fire, flood, explosion, earthquake, or other natural forces, war, civil unrest, any strike or labor disturbance. Such excuse from liability shall be effective only to the extent and duration of the event(s) causing the failure or delay in performance and provided that the party has not caused such event(s) to occur. Notice of a party’s failure or delay in performance due to force majeure must be given to the other party within five (5) calendar days after its occurrence. All delivery dates under this Agreement that have been affected by force majeure shall be tolled for the duration of such force majeure. In no event shall any party be required to prevent or settle any labor disturbance or dispute. In the event of a force majeure that persists for thirty (30) days or more, then either party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the other party.
ollama_generated: 14.9 Unforeseeable Events Exemption. Under this Agreement, neither party will be held responsible for any failure or delay in fulfilling their obligations if such occurrence is attributed to an event not reasonably foreseeable or controllable, such as Acts of God, fire, flood, explosion, earthquake, or other natural disasters, war, civil unrest, strikes or labor disturbances. The exemption from liability applies only for the duration and extent of the events causing the performance issue and is contingent upon the party not having caused the occurrence of said event(s). Notification of a performance setback due to unforeseen circumstances must be communicated to the other party within five (5) calendar days following the incident. All timelines specified in this Agreement that have been influenced by such events will be temporarily suspended for the duration of the unforeseeable occurrence. Neither party is obligated, nor can they be compelled, to resolve any labor disputes or disturbances. If an unforeseen event persists for thirty (30) consecutive days, either party holds the right to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the other.
